solution_line_template: Julia baked one less than {cakes_per_day_base} cakes per day, or {cakes_per_day_base}-{less_cakes}=<<{cakes_per_day_base}-{less_cakes}={cakes_per_day}>>{cakes_per_day} cakes per day.
For {num_days} days, Julia baked {cakes_per_day} cakes per day, for a total of {cakes_per_day}*{num_days}=<<{cakes_per_day}*{num_days}={total_cakes_baked}>>{total_cakes_baked} cakes.

Over {num_days} days, every other day, Clifford sneaks into Julia's house and eats one of Julia's cakes resulting in disappearance of {num_days}/{eating_frequency_divisor}=<<{num_days}/{eating_frequency_divisor}={cakes_eaten_by_clifford}>>{cakes_eaten_by_clifford} cakes.
At the end of 6 days, Julia has {total_cakes_baked}-{cakes_eaten_by_clifford}=<<{total_cakes_baked}-{cakes_eaten_by_clifford}={cakes_remaining}>>{cakes_remaining} cakes remaining.
